name: Thorin Ironledger
title: Vaultwright
description: A stout dwarf with a braided beard adorned with iron rings. Thorin's hands are calloused from years of carving vaultstones, and his sharp eyes miss nothing.

greeting.first_time: Hail and well met! I'm Thorin Ironledger, Vaultwright of Ironpeak. These vaults have stood for five generations, carved by my ancestors into the mountain's heart.
greeting.returning: Back again, are ye? Your vaultstone keeps true.
greeting.native_race: Aye, kinsman! Your clan vault is ever ready.

about_service.text: The Stonevault is clan heritage, carved deep into the mountain by the first dwarves who settled these peaks. Every dwarf has a vault here by birthright. But outsiders... well, ye'll need a vaultstone carved and keyed to ye personally. It's ancient work, precise work.

ask_about_engraving.text: The Vaultstone Engraving Fee is 55 gold. I'll carve ye a personal stone, inscribed with your name and sealed with a lock only ye can open. Once it's done, your vault is yours for life. Dwarven stonework lasts forever, ye know.

pay_engraving.text: Good! Let me fetch my tools... *sound of hammer on stone* ...There! Your vaultstone is ready. She'll guard your treasures well. Come, I'll show ye to your vault.
pay_engraving.success: Your vaultstone has been engraved. You may now store items in the Stonevault.
pay_engraving.failure: Ah, ye're short on coin. Come back when ye have 55 gold, friend.

use_storage.text: Right this way. Mind the stairsâ€”they're steep, but solid as the mountain itself.

maybe_later.text: Aye, take your time. The stone isn't goin' anywhere. Neither am I!

goodbye.text: Stone and steel keep ye safe, friend. Until next time.
